articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Police Shooting Outrage
articles.description: Today Rev Al Sharpton was joined by Benjamin Crump and April Pipkins on the wrongful death of an innocent man shot over Thanksgiving weekend in Alabama, and the ongoing debate of the need for gun control in our country.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: GOTCHA: NRA Edition
articles.description: In this week’s Gotcha, Rev. Al Sharpton shares his thoughts on the on-going feud between physicians and the National Rifle Association, which gained new urgency when Dr. Tamera O’Neal was gunned down outside of Mercy hospital in Chicago.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: One on One with Rep. Yvette Clarke
articles.description: Rev. Al Sharpton sits down with Rep. Yvette Clarke to discuss the recent Blue Wave after the midterms, and the power of the new Congressional Black Caucus, and what they plan to do in the future.

articles.title: PoliticsNation 11/25/18
articles.description: PoliticsNation is hosted by Al Sharpton, one of America's most renowned civil rights leader.
articles.content: PoliticsNation with Al Sharpton 11/25/18 PoliticsNation is hosted by Al Sharpton, one of America's most renowned civil rights leader. descriptionLimit">... more Duration: {{video.duration.momentjs}} Up next in: Latest MSNBC videos

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: U.S. closes world’s busiest border
articles.description: The United States closes the world’s busiest border in Southern Californian after migrants approached the border crossing earlier.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Santa Larry and Mrs. Claus visit AM JOY!
articles.description: Santa Larry returns to the Mall of America, and brings Mrs. Claus for a very special visit to AM JOY with Joy Reid.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Jill Wine-Banks: We need to look at China which has given trademarks to Trump’s daughter
articles.description: As House Democrats prepare for investigations related to Donald Trump, Watergate prosecutor Jill Wine-Banks tells AM JOY, ‘We need to look at Saudi Arabia, who he continues to defend.’ Joy Reid and her panel discuss.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Where’s the media fascination with Ivanka Trump’s misuse of private email?
articles.description: Ivanka Trump’s misuse of private email to discuss government business has been only a slight scandal compared to the treatment Hillary Clinton received for using private email. Joy Reid and her panel discuss the unequal media coverage.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Undocumented man detained by ICE as protesters supporting him arrested
articles.description: Rep. G.K. Butterfield (D-NC) joins AM JOY on the undocumented immigrant residing in his district who according to reports was told he would be able to apply for deferred action, but was instead detained by ICE for deportation. Joy Reid is also joined by two o…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Joy’s guest give top picks for 2020 Democratic presidential nomination
articles.description: The 2020 Democratic presidential and vice presidential nomination could go to two of dozens of possible contenders. Joy Reid discusses the top picks of her expert panelists.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: 'I don't think the American people will let him off the hook'
articles.description: Austan Goolsbee, former chair of the Council of Economic Advisers for President Obama, on what could happen if economy slows.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: 'I think it's going to be spin'
articles.description: MSNBC Legal Analyst Mimi Rocah on the response the president’s legal team will have to Robert Mueller’s Russia report.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Migrants storm U.S. border
articles.description: Migrants in Tijuana, Mexico storm the United States border near San Diego, California.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Tiffany Cross: Mississippi is a state that should be winnable by Democrat Mike Espy
articles.description: The Mississippi U.S. Senate race sees a new controversy as it has been reported that Republican candidate Cindy Hyde-Smith attended a ‘segregation academy’ as a young woman. Joy Reid and her panel discuss the chances of Democrat Mike Espy winning the run-off …

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: 'If you say hanging in Mississippi you can only be talking about an instrument of racial suppression'
articles.description: Howell Raines, former Executive Editor of the New York Times on the runoff between Republican incumbent Senator Cindy Hyde-Smith and Democrat Mike Espy.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Rep. Connolly: 'We have a very rich menu unfortunately from which to choose'
articles.description: Democratic congressman Gerry Connolly gives his number one priority when it comes to investigating the White House.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Can Espy pull off an upset in Mississippi runoff election?
articles.description: All eyes are on the final race to end the midterm season … Mississippi’s runoff Senate election.  But can Democrat Mike Espy follow the lead of Alabama’s Doug Jones and pull off an upset in a solid red state?  MSNBC’s David Gura breaks down the state of the r…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Who is Jerome Corsi?
articles.description: Special Counsel Robert Mueller's latest target is Jerome Corsi, who's been on the fringe of some of the biggest controversies in recent memory.  MSNBC’s David Gura breaks down who Corsi is and how he is connected to several other key figures Mueller is invest…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Rep. Schiff to Wapo: House needs to find out about Trump’s ties to Saudis
articles.description: MSNBC’s David Gura and a panel of guests discuss why President Trump seems to want to give Saudi Arabia a pass on the murder of journalist Jamal Khashoggi, telling Americans it’s all about the money.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Reported Deal with Mexico paves way for Asylum Overhaul
articles.description: There are reports of a new agreement between President Trump and the incoming Mexican Obrador administration which says asylum seekers will wait in Mexico while their cases are processed stateside.  MSNBC’s David Gura discusses with his panel of guests.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: A recount in Florida? Why does that sound familiar?
articles.description: Florida, Florida, Florida! With the number of recounts in the Florida elections this year, Chuck is having some familiar flashbacks.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Former CIA official: Saudis "We’re more important to them than they are to us."
articles.description: MSNBC Global Affairs Analyst and Former CIA Acting Director John McLaughlin on Trump's lethal force authorization, plus where U.S./Saudi relations stand now.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: "It's pathetic. It's horrible. It's deeply disturbing." Fmr. Ambassador on Pres. Trump standing by Saudis despite Khashoggi killing.
articles.description: Former U.S. ambassador to Russia Michael McFaul says President Trump "looks really weak when he makes these statements about our dependencies on the Saudis when it's the exact opposite."

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Fmr. White House Chief of Staff: 'This was a rookie mistake'
articles.description: Former White House Chief of Staff, Andrew Card, says that Ivanka Trump should just "come clean" about her use of a private email account and "she was a rookie coming into government."

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Are Hillary Clinton and Ivanka Trump emails the same thing?
articles.description: "You can't lock up one woman and the other one gets a pass." Sophia Nelson, former House GOP Committee Counsel to Kayleigh Mcenany, RNC Spokesperson about Ivanka Trump's emails. Democratic strategists Don Calloway and Peter Emerson also weigh in on the contro…
